Start.description: Define a new project to get started

Problem.description: This template clearly identifies and describes the core issue your innovation seeks to address, emphasizing who it affects and why solving it matters. Clearly defining the problem ensures your project remains focused, relevant, and impactful.

Resources.description: This template maps out the available resources within your organization, including people, finances, equipment, knowledge, and intellectual property. Understanding these assets helps you realistically plan and execute your innovation strategy.

Strategic Foundation.description: The Strategic Foundation template connects your project with the broader goals, mission, vision, and values of your organization. This alignment ensures that your innovation efforts support and enhance long-term organizational objectives.

Design Challenge.description: This template translates your innovation problem into clear and actionable "How Might We" questions. These questions set the stage for creative exploration, guiding your teamâ€™s brainstorming while ensuring relevance to the original issue.

Customer Persona.description: Customer Personas provide detailed profiles of your target audience, capturing their demographics, behaviors, needs, and attitudes. Developing personas fosters empathy within your team and ensures your solutions are tailored precisely to user needs.

Empathy Map.description: An Empathy Map documents the experiences, thoughts, emotions, and behaviors of your target customers. This deeper understanding allows your team to identify meaningful opportunities and design solutions that resonate genuinely with users.

PESTEL-Analysis.description: PESTEL Analysis examines external factors (Political, Economic, Social, Technological, Environmental, Legal) influencing your innovation. Understanding these factors helps anticipate potential challenges and opportunities, guiding strategic planning.

Trends.description: Trend Radar helps identify and analyze trends at various levels (Mega, Macro, Meso, Micro) that could impact your innovation project. This awareness ensures your solutions remain relevant and aligned with evolving market dynamics.

SWOT-Analysis.description: SWOT Analysis evaluates your project's internal strengths and weaknesses alongside external opportunities and threats. This structured approach supports informed decision-making and strategic positioning of your innovation.

ProblemsAndJobs.description: This template focuses on the core tasks and challenges your customers face, known as Jobs-to-be-Done. Clearly outlining these helps your team prioritize features and solutions that address genuine customer needs rather than superficial preferences.

Ideation.description: Ideation involves generating a diverse range of ideas through structured brainstorming methods, including basic idea generation, the ABC method, and lateral thinking. This process ensures a comprehensive exploration of potential solutions.

Idea Evaluation.description: Idea Evaluation systematically assesses potential solutions using criteria such as desirability, feasibility, viability, and sustainability (DFVS). This structured approach prioritizes ideas with the highest potential impact and practicality.

Value Proposition Canvas.description: This template clarifies the fit between your solution and customer needs, explicitly connecting customer pains and gains to the benefits your solution provides. It ensures your innovation effectively meets user requirements and delivers clear value.

Business Model Canvas.description: The Business Model Canvas clearly outlines how your innovation will deliver value, detailing essential elements such as customer segments, value propositions, key activities, resources, partnerships, cost structures, and revenue streams. It ensures your innovation has a viable and sustainable business model.

Test Card.description: This template documents your team's hypotheses and outlines structured experiments to test these assumptions. By providing clear metrics and evaluation criteria, it supports evidence-based decision-making and rapid learning cycles.

ProductConcept.description: This template captures the essence of your innovation, including its name, description, and key features..

UserFeedback.description: Ask you user for feedback about your current product.

InnovationLearnings.description: The Learnings template captures important insights, lessons, and feedback gained throughout the innovation process. This documentation supports continuous improvement, helping future innovation projects benefit from past experiences.

End.description: This template summarizes and visualizes all key elements and insights from the completed templates. It provides a consolidated view of your final innovation, clearly illustrating how it addresses the original problem and aligns with strategic goals, aiding effective communication with stakeholders.
